maml:description.maml:para: Gets Azure Key Vault instances.

The Get-AzureKeyVault cmdlet gets information about the Azure Key Vault instances in a subscription. You can view all key vault instances in a subscription, or filter your results by a resource group or a particular key vault.
Specifies the name of a resource group. This cmdlet gets key vault instances in the resource group that this parameter specifies.

Specifies the name of a subscription. This cmdlet gets key vault instances in the subscription that this parameter specifies. If you do not specify this parameter, the cmdlet gets key vault instances in the current subscription associated with your account.

Specifies the name of a subscription. This cmdlet gets key vault instances in the subscription that this parameter specifies. If you do not specify this parameter, the cmdlet gets key vault instances in the current subscription associated with your account.

Specifies the name of the key vault to get. If you specify this parameter, this cmdlet returns the key vault instance that by that name. If no key vault instance by that name exists, the cmdlet returns an empty list. If you do not specify this parameter, this cmdlet returns all key vault instances in the subscription.

Specifies the name of a subscription. This cmdlet gets key vault instances in the subscription that this parameter specifies. If you do not specify this parameter, the cmdlet gets key vault instances in the current subscription associated with your account.
Specifies the name of a resource group. This cmdlet gets key vault instances in the resource group that this parameter specifies.

Specifies the name of a subscription. This cmdlet gets key vault instances in the subscription that this parameter specifies. If you do not specify this parameter, the cmdlet gets key vault instances in the current subscription associated with your account.

Specifies the name of the key vault to get. If you specify this parameter, this cmdlet returns the key vault instance that by that name. If no key vault instance by that name exists, the cmdlet returns an empty list. If you do not specify this parameter, this cmdlet returns all key vault instances in the subscription.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get all key vaults in your current subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all the key vaults in your current subscription.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get a specific key vault

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the key vault named Contoso03Vault in your current subscription, and then stores it in the $MyVault variable. You can inspect the properties of $MyVault to get details about the key vault.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Get key vaults in a resource group

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all the key vaults in the resource group named ContosoPayRollResourceGroup.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Get key vaults in a specified subscription
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzureKeyVault -SubscriptionName 'Visual Studio Ultimate with MSDN'

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all the key vaults in the named subscription. If you do not specify the SubscriptionName parameter, this cmdlet gets key vaults for your current subscription.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an Azure Key Vault instance.

The New-AzureKeyVault cmdlet creates an Azure Key Vault instance in the specified subscription. This cmdlet also grants permissions to the currently logged on user to add, remove, or list keys and secrets in the vault.
Specifies a name of the key vault to create. The name can be any combination of letters, digits, or hyphens. The name must start and end with a letter or digit. The name must be universally unique.
Specifies the name of a resource group in which to create the key vault. If the named resource group does not exist, this cmdlet creates it.
Specifies the Azure region in which to create the key vault. Use the command Get-AzureLocation to see your choices. For more information, type Get-Help Get-AzureLocation.
This parameter is reserved for future use.
Specifies the name of the subscription in which to create the key vault.
Specifies the SKU of the key vault instance. For information about which features are available for each SKU, see the Azure Key Vault Pricing website (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=512521).
This parameter is reserved for future use.
Specifies the Azure region in which to create the key vault. Use the command Get-AzureLocation to see your choices. For more information, type Get-Help Get-AzureLocation.
Specifies the name of a resource group in which to create the key vault. If the named resource group does not exist, this cmdlet creates it.
Specifies the SKU of the key vault instance. For information about which features are available for each SKU, see the Azure Key Vault Pricing website (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=512521).
Specifies the name of the subscription in which to create the key vault.
Specifies a name of the key vault to create. The name can be any combination of letters, digits, or hyphens. The name must start and end with a letter or digit. The name must be universally unique.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a key vault named Contoso03Vault, in the Azure region East US. The command adds the key vault to the resource group named Group14. If the specified resource group does not exist, the cmdlet creates that group for you.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Create a Standard key vault in a specific subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a key vault, just like the previous example. This command specifies the Azure subscription, in case you have more than one Azure subscription. The command also specifies a value of Standard for the SKU parameter to create a Standard key vault.

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes an Azure Key Vault instance.
The Remove-AzureKeyVault cmdlet deletes the specified Azure Key Vault instance. It also deletes all keys and secrets contained in that instance.
Specifies the name of the key vault to remove.
Specifies the name of the subscription that contains the key vault to delete. If you do not specify a subscription, this cmdlet uses your current subscription.
Indicates that the cmdlet does not prompt you for confirmation. By default, this cmdlet prompts you to confirm that you want to delete the key vault.
Indicates that the cmdlet does not prompt you for confirmation. By default, this cmdlet prompts you to confirm that you want to delete the key vault.
Specifies the name of the subscription that contains the key vault to delete. If you do not specify a subscription, this cmdlet uses your current subscription.
Specifies the name of the key vault to remove.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the key vault named Contoso03Vault from your current subscription.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Remove a key vault from a specified subscription
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Remove-AzureKeyVault -VaultName 'Contoso03Vault' -SubscriptionName 'Visual Studio Ultimate with MSDN'

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the key vault named Contoso03Vault from the named subscription. If you want to remove a key vault from a subscription other than your current subscription, specify the alternative subscription by name.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes all permissions for a user or application from the Azure Key Vault.

The Remove-AzureKeyVaultAccessPolicy cmdlet removes all permissions for the specified user or application from the Azure Key Vault. Even if you remove all permissions, the owner of the Azure subscription that contains the vault retains the permission to add permissions to the key vault.
Specifies the name of the key vault. This cmdlet removes permissions for the key vault that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the object ID of the user or service principal in Azure Active Directory for which to remove permissions.
Specifies the name of the subscription in which to remove permissions for a key vault.
Specifies the name of the key vault. This cmdlet removes permissions for the key vault that this parameter specifies.

Specifies the service principal name of the application whose permissions you want to remove. Specify the application ID, also known as client ID, registered for the application in Azure Active Directory.
Specifies the name of the subscription in which to remove permissions for a key vault.
Specifies the name of the key vault. This cmdlet removes permissions for the key vault that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the user principal name of the user whose access you want to remove.
Specifies the name of the subscription in which to remove permissions for a key vault.
Specifies the object ID of the user or service principal in Azure Active Directory for which to remove permissions.

Specifies the service principal name of the application whose permissions you want to remove. Specify the application ID, also known as client ID, registered for the application in Azure Active Directory.
Specifies the name of the subscription in which to remove permissions for a key vault.
Specifies the user principal name of the user whose access you want to remove.
Specifies the name of the key vault. This cmdlet removes permissions for the key vault that this parameter specifies.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove permissions for a user

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes all the permissions that a user PattiFuller@contoso.com has on the key vault named Contoso03Vault.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Remove permissions for an application

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes all the permissions that an application has on the vault named Contoso03Vault. This example identifies the application by using the service principal name registered in Azure Active Directory, http://payroll.contoso.com.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Remove permissions for an application by using its object ID

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes all the permissions that an application has on the vault named Contoso03Vault. This example identifies the application by the object ID of the service principal.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Remove permissions from a key vault in another subscription
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Remove-AzureKeyVaultAccessPolicy -VaultName 'Contoso27Vault' -ObjectID 34595082-9346-41b6-8d6b-295a2808b8db -SubscriptionName 'Visual Studio Ultimate with MSDN'

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes all the permissions that an application has on the vault named Contoso27Vault. This command specifies the value of the name of one of your subscriptions for the SubscriptionName parameter. This example removes permissions for a key vault that is not part of your current subscription.

maml:description.maml:para: Grants permissions for a user or application to perform operations with the Azure Key Vault.

The Set-AzureKeyVaultAccessPolicy cmdlet grants permission for a user or application to perform the specified operations with the Azure Key Vault. This cmdlet replaces existing permissions for the specified user or application. It does not modify the permissions that other users or applications have on the key vault.

The following directories must all be the same Azure directory:
-- The Azure directory in which the key vault owner's user account resides. -- The default directory of the Azure subscription in which the key vault resides. -- The Azure directory in which the application service principal is registered.

Examples of scenarios when these conditions are not met and this cmdlet will not work:
-- Authorizing a user from a different organization to manage your key vault. Each organization has its own directory. -- Your Azure account has multiple directories. If you register an application in a directory other than the default directory, you will not be able to authorize that application to use your key vaults. The application must be in the default directory.
Specifies the name of a key vault. This cmdlet modifies the access policy for the key vault that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the object ID of the user or service principal in Azure Active Directory for which to grant permissions.

Specifies key operation permissions to grant to a user or service principal. Valid values are:
-- get -- decrypt -- encrypt -- unwrapKey -- wrapKey -- verify -- sign -- list -- update -- create -- import -- delete -- backup -- restore -- all
Specify a comma separated list without quotation marks.

Specifies secret operation permissions to grant to a user or service principal. Valid values are:
-- get -- set -- list -- delete -- all
Specify a comma separated list without quotation marks.

Specifies the name of the Azure subscription that contains the Azure key vault and the user or application service principal. If you do not specify a subscription, the cmdlet uses your current subscription.
Specifies the name of a key vault. This cmdlet modifies the access policy for the key vault that this parameter specifies.

Specifies key operation permissions to grant to a user or service principal. Valid values are:
-- get -- decrypt -- encrypt -- unwrapKey -- wrapKey -- verify -- sign -- list -- update -- create -- import -- delete -- backup -- restore -- all
Specify a comma separated list without quotation marks.

Specifies secret operation permissions to grant to a user or service principal. Valid values are:
-- get -- set -- list -- delete -- all
Specify a comma separated list without quotation marks.

Specifies the name of the Azure subscription that contains the Azure key vault and the user or application service principal. If you do not specify a subscription, the cmdlet uses your current subscription.
Specifies the name of a key vault. This cmdlet modifies the access policy for the key vault that this parameter specifies.

Specifies the service principal name of the application to which to grant permissions. Specify the application ID, also known as client ID, registered for the application in Azure Active Directory. The application with the service principal name that this parameter specifies must be registered in the Azure directory that contains your current subscription or the subscription specified by the SubscriptionName parameter, if that parameter is specified.

Specifies key operation permissions to grant to a user or service principal. Valid values are:
-- get -- decrypt -- encrypt -- unwrapKey -- wrapKey -- verify -- sign -- list -- update -- create -- import -- delete -- backup -- restore -- all
Specify a comma separated list without quotation marks.

Specifies secret operation permissions to grant to a user or service principal. Valid values are:
-- get -- set -- list -- delete -- all
Specify a comma separated list without quotation marks.

Specifies the name of the Azure subscription that contains the Azure key vault and the user or application service principal. If you do not specify a subscription, the cmdlet uses your current subscription.
Specifies the name of a key vault. This cmdlet modifies the access policy for the key vault that this parameter specifies.

Specifies the user principal name of the user to whom to grant permissions. This user principal name must exist in the directory associated with the current subscription or in the subscription specified by the SubscriptionName parameter, if that parameter is specified.

Specifies key operation permissions to grant to a user or service principal. Valid values are:
-- get -- decrypt -- encrypt -- unwrapKey -- wrapKey -- verify -- sign -- list -- update -- create -- import -- delete -- backup -- restore -- all
Specify a comma separated list without quotation marks.

Specifies secret operation permissions to grant to a user or service principal. Valid values are:
-- get -- set -- list -- delete -- all
Specify a comma separated list without quotation marks.

Specifies the name of the Azure subscription that contains the Azure key vault and the user or application service principal. If you do not specify a subscription, the cmdlet uses your current subscription.
Specifies the object ID of the user or service principal in Azure Active Directory for which to grant permissions.

Specifies key operation permissions to grant to a user or service principal. Valid values are:
-- get -- decrypt -- encrypt -- unwrapKey -- wrapKey -- verify -- sign -- list -- update -- create -- import -- delete -- backup -- restore -- all
Specify a comma separated list without quotation marks.

Specifies secret operation permissions to grant to a user or service principal. Valid values are:
-- get -- set -- list -- delete -- all
Specify a comma separated list without quotation marks.

Specifies the service principal name of the application to which to grant permissions. Specify the application ID, also known as client ID, registered for the application in Azure Active Directory. The application with the service principal name that this parameter specifies must be registered in the Azure directory that contains your current subscription or the subscription specified by the SubscriptionName parameter, if that parameter is specified.

Specifies the name of the Azure subscription that contains the Azure key vault and the user or application service principal. If you do not specify a subscription, the cmdlet uses your current subscription.

Specifies the user principal name of the user to whom to grant permissions. This user principal name must exist in the directory associated with the current subscription or in the subscription specified by the SubscriptionName parameter, if that parameter is specified.
Specifies the name of a key vault. This cmdlet modifies the access policy for the key vault that this parameter specifies.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Grant permissions to a user for a key vault

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command grants permissions for a user in your Azure Active Directory, PattiFuller@contoso.com, to perform operations with a key vault named Contoso03Vault.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Grant permissions for an application service principal to read and write secrets

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command grants permissions for an application for a vault named Contoso03Vault. The ServicePrincipalName parameter specifies the application. The application must be registered in your Azure Active Directory. The value of the ServicePrincipalName parameter must be either the service principal name of the application or the application ID GUID. This example specifies the service principal name http://payroll.contoso.com, and the command grants the application permissions to read and write secrets.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Grant permissions for an application using its object ID

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command grants the application permissions to read and write secrets. This example specifies the application using the object ID of the service principal of the application.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Grant permissions for a key vault in another subscription
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Set-AzureKeyVaultAccessPolicy -VaultName 'Contoso27Vault' -ObjectId 34595082-9346-41b6-8d6b-295a2808b8db -PermissionsToSecrets get,set -SubscriptionName 'Visual Studio Ultimate with MSDN'

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command grants the application permissions to read and write secrets. This command specifies the value of the name of one of your subscriptions for the SubscriptionName parameter. This example grants permissions for a key vault that is not part of your current subscription.
